column2: #The fourth indicator analyzed is median household income over time from 2000 to 2019.As we contemplated above, the increase in median rents in TOD areas may show that residents are willing to pay more to live in TOD areas. By looking at median household income in TOD areas, we hoped to get a sense of whether or not people with "high" incomes lived in TOD areas. Generally,the visualizations prove that in recent years (2019) higher income households do indeed live in TOD areas when compared to non-TOD areas. This could mean that those with flexible incomes were choosing to live near transportation.
labs(title = "Median Household Income 2000-2019", subtitle = "Real Dollars, The red border denotes areas close to metro stations", caption = "Figure 1.4") +
